events.originalText: Construction of Tokyo Skytree, the world's tallest tower and second-tallest structure, was completed.
events.subtitle: Tokyo Skytree
events.headline: Tokyo Skytree, World's Tallest Tower, Completed

events.originalText: Belgian author Misha Defonseca admitted that her bestselling memoir about surviving the Holocaust was in fact a literary forgery.
events.subtitle: Misha Defonseca
events.headline: Belgian Author Misha Defonseca Admits Memoir Forgery

events.originalText: Haitian president Jean-Bertrand Aristide was overthrown following popular rebel uprising.
events.subtitle: Jean-Bertrand Aristide
events.headline: Haitian President Aristide Overthrown by Rebel Uprising

events.originalText: In the deadliest aviation accident in Peruvian history, Faucett Flight 251 crashed on approach to Rodríguez Ballón International Airport, killing all 123 people aboard.
events.subtitle: Faucett Perú Flight 251
events.headline: Deadliest Aviation Accident in Peruvian History: Faucett Flight 251 Crash

events.originalText: La Bougie du Sapeur, a humorous French newspaper that is published only on leap days, printed its first issue.
events.subtitle: La Bougie du Sapeur
events.headline: French Leap Day Newspaper La Bougie du Sapeur Prints First Issue

events.originalText: The deadliest earthquake in Moroccan history struck the city of Agadir, killing at least 12,000 people.
events.subtitle: 1960 Agadir earthquake
events.headline: Deadliest Earthquake in Moroccan History Hits Agadir, 12,000 Dead

events.originalText: The Admiralty Islands campaign during the Pacific War of World War II began when American forces assaulted Los Negros Island, the third largest of the Admiralty Islands.
events.subtitle: Admiralty Islands campaign
events.headline: Admiralty Islands Campaign Begins in Pacific War of World War II

events.originalText: A group of Polish nobles established the Bar Confederation to defend the internal and external independence of the Polish–Lithuanian Commonwealth against Russian influence and King Stanisław II Augustus (portrait shown).
events.subtitle: Szlachta
events.headline: Polish Nobles Establish Bar Confederation Against Russian Influence

events.originalText: Queen Anne's War: French and Native American forces raided the English settlement of Deerfield, Massachusetts, killing more than 50 colonists.
events.subtitle: Queen Anne's War
events.headline: Queen Anne's War: French and Native American Forces Raid Deerfield, MA
